meanings.definition: Aediles: plural noun, ancient Roman magistrates responsible for public buildings and games
meanings.sent1: The aediles oversaw the construction of the new amphitheater in the city.
meanings.sent2: The aediles organized the annual festival with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The aediles decided to have a friendly competition to see who could build the tallest tower of blocks.
meanings.sent4: The aediles were like architects of fun, designing games and events for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The aediles were the guardians of entertainment, ensuring that the public had a good time.

meanings.definition: Aediles: verb, to perform the duties of an aedile
meanings.sent1: She aediles diligently, making sure every detail was taken care of.
meanings.sent2: He aediles with dedication, ensuring that the public spaces were well-maintained.
meanings.sent3: They aediles together, creating a harmonious atmosphere in the city.
meanings.sent4: The team aediles like a well-oiled machine, each member contributing their skills.
meanings.sent5: Aediling requires a keen eye for detail and a passion for community service.
